definition: gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: It was as if the Night sang dirges with clenched teeth.
sentences.chinese: 那彷彿是夜神正在那兒咬牙切齒地唱輓歌。

sentences.english: It also involves howls of exasperation cursing and gnashing of teeth.
sentences.chinese: 還包括憤激的狂笑詛咒和咬牙切齒。

sentences.english: Bury your talents, and you get “weeping and gnashing ofteeth.”
sentences.chinese: 埋藏自己的才能，你將“哭泣並咬牙切齒”。

sentences.english: The gentleman gnashed his teeth when he saw the damage to his new car.
sentences.chinese: 那位先生看到他的新車被弄壞了，氣得咬牙切齒。

sentences.english: “Orange, ” Hattie hissed, nudging me hard in the ribs.
sentences.chinese: “橙色，”海蒂咬牙切齒地說，使勁捅我的肋骨。

sentences.english: She could hate as passionately as she could love.
sentences.chinese: 她能恨得咬牙切齒，也能愛得一往情深。

sentences.english: 'Thanks for the shower,' the young Mr. Gates snapped.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨咬牙切齒地說，感謝給我洗了個冷水澡。

sentences.english: I was gnashing my teeth with rage.
Then madame, with her teeth set, tied a very terrible knot indeed.
sentences.chinese: 老闆娘咬牙切齒地抽緊了一個很可怕的結。

sentences.english: Andthis leads to “weeping and gnashing of teeth, ” i.e. sorrow and depression.
sentences.chinese: 這將導致“哭泣和咬牙切齒”，就是指悲傷和絕望。

sentences.english: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.
sentences.chinese: 衆人聽見這話，就極其惱怒，向司提反咬牙切齒。

sentences.english: There's gnawing and gnashing of teeth.
sentences.chinese: 還有的啃和咬牙切齒的。

sentences.english: My sister and I listen to and gnash, resentfully to walk home.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐聽了，氣得咬牙切齒，憤憤不平地走回家去。

sentences.english: Thinking only of some utter destruction and disaster, he bided his time.
sentences.chinese: 他咬牙切齒，在盤算如何毀滅敵人的遐想中打發時光。

definition: to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
